titles.title: Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug) (fols. 2ra – 35ra)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Priest (qäsis) Ḫabtä Śǝllase (mentioned throughout the Ms., esp. in Additio 1, fol. 35ra, ls. 13-14; cp. also fols. 4ra, l.9; 4rb, ls. 9-10; 22vb, ls. 13-14; 23ra, l.13; 23va, l.14; 31vb, l.17; 34vb, l.8). Wälättä Śǝllase (mentioned throughout the Ms., esp. in Additio 1, fol. 35ra, l.14; cp. also fols. 23ra, l.14; 23va, l.15; 32ra, l.1; 34vb, l.9). Some other names are mentioned in Additio 1: Mäzgäbä Śǝllase, ˤAmätä Śǝllase, Ṣǝge Haymanot, Täwäldä Mädḫәn, Ṣäware Mäsqäl, Marqos, ˤAmätä Mikaʾel, Wälättä Ṣadәqan, Wälättä Giyorgis.

txstates.txstate: The sewing is damaged on the spine. Fols. 20, 28 and 36 are slightly damaged by rodents.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards; two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: I(9/fols. 1r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(6/fols. 18r-23v) – IV(6/fols. 24r-29v) – V(5/30r-34v) – VI(2/fols. 35r-36v).

taunit.ln-info: On average, the number of the lines to a folio is 17/18.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

txlines.txline: On average, the number of the lines to a folio is 17/18.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

desccontent.text: I. Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
desccontent.mss: D´Abbadie 247 (19th cent.), fols. 80r-92v: “Sermon de Jacques de Saroug sur le dimanche” (ChAbb 139). EMML no. 378 (1959/70), fols. 1r-23v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 93; Church of St. Gabriel, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 400 (late 19th cent.), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 116; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 624 (1908), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 372; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 885 (1916/30), fols. 3r-19r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML III, 210; Church of Qwǝsqwam, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1512 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-4v, 71rv, 100v-107r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 12; Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1589 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-30v: “Dersāna sanbat, attributed to James of Sarug” (EMML V, 77; Private library of Dr. Abraham Demoz, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1656 (19th cent.), fols. 2r-22v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 141; Church of Dämṭa Giyorgis, Gubalafto, Wällo). EMML no. 1672 (20th cent.), fols. 1r-66r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 148; Private library of Mämhǝr Gäbrä Mäsqäl Täsfaye, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 2190 (1779/1800), fols. 124r-137v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 302; Church of Miṭaq ʾAmanuʾel, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2323 (1923/24), fols. 3r-27r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 372; Church of ʾƎlqo Mädḫane ʿAläm, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2392 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 222r-228r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 463; Church of Miṭaq Täklä Haymanot, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2726 (1775-1809), fols. 4r-5r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML VII, 117; Church of Ḥarr ʾAmba Yoḥannәs, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 3200 (17th cent.), fols. 2r-4v, 5r-6v, 15rv, 17rv, 18rv, 20r-21r, 22r-23v: “Homily on the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat] ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML VIII, 150; Church of Sarya Mikaʾel, Zanǧira, Wärana Basso, Shoa). EMML no. 3341 (1755/69, 1769/96), fols. 48v-63v: “Homily of James of Sarug about Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 215; Church of Gädam Maryam, ʾAsagәrt, Shoa). EMML no. 3472 (18th cent.), fols. 146rv, 135r-145v, 147r-149v: “Homily of James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 286; Church of Gubbalafto Täklä Haymanot, Yäǧǧu, Wällo). EMML no. 3965 (20th cent.), fols. 2r-3v: “Homily by James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML IX, 256; Church of Laǧǧa Gәnd Giyorgis, Wärana Baso, Shoa). EMML no. 4017 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 122r-147v: “Homily by James of Sarug on the Christian Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML X, 9; Church of Mäsḉa Maryam, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4362 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-15r: “Homily on the (Christian) Sabbath [Dersāna Sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 125; Church of ʾƎllägänd Mikaʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4435 (1891), fols. 182r-186r: “Homily on Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 152; Church of Sälla Dәnqay Marqos, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa). Orient. 18, fols. 121r-138v: “Homilia Jacobi Sarugensis de Sabbatho” (DillmLond 22). StrRyMan 7 (17th/18th cent.), fols. 44v-49r: “Sermon of Jacob of Serug” (StrJRyM 14). StrANL Conti Rossini 71 (19th/20th cent.), fols. 62r-64v: “Sermon de Jacques de Seroug” (StrANL 188). TelAviv, Library Faitllovitch, 34 (18th cent.), fols. 1-28 (cp. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 344).

edition.text: ድርሳነ፡ ሰንበት፡ (Dǝrsanä sänbät, ‘Homily of the Sabbathʼ), ed. by ʾabba GÄBRÄ KIDAN BÄZZABBƎH – ʾaggafari GÄBRÄ IYÄSUS – MÄŠÄŠA GƎZZAW; Addis Abäba 1947 A.M. [1954/55 A.D.]; ibid. ed. by TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚƎLLASE, Addis Abäba 1959 A.M. [1966/67 A.D.]. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 343-61.

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 2ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘስሩግ፨ በእንተ፡ ቅድስት፡ ሰንበት፤ ክርስቲያን፤ ዘደረሰ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘስሩግ፨ ስምዑ፡ ኦፍቁራንየ፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ …
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 2ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. (This is) the homily which ʾabba Jaqob of Serug composed on St. Sabbath of Christians, which ʾabba James of Serug, Orthodox in faith, composed. Listen, my beloved ones, sons of the church …
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 34vb (l.10) – fol. 35ra (l.10): ... ወአድኅነነ፡ እምኵሉ፡ ምንዳቤ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ ወህየንተ፤ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፤ ዘጸሐፈ፡ ወአጽሐፈ፤  እምሀከከ፤ ሰብእ፡ በጽላሎትከ፤ ወክድኖ፡ እምባህለ፡ ልሳን፡ በመንጦላእትከ፤ በም[fol. 35ra]ድር፡ ወበሰማያት፡ አጽንሐ፡ ዓስበ፡ ህየንተ፡ ፩፤ ፴፡ ፷፡ ወ፻፡ ወአድኅነነ፤ እምኵሉ፤ እኩይ፤ ዘበምድር፡ ወእምኵሉ፤ ኵነኔ፤ ዘበሰማያት፡ ለኵልነ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ዛቲ፤ መቅደስ፤ ውሉደ፡ ጥምቀት፤ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፨፨፨፨
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 34vb (l.10): ... and save us from each plague of flesh and soul, and instead ... The one who wrote this book and let it be written, (protect) them from the troubles of people by your shade, and cover them from  the (evel) words of the tongue by your curtains. In the Heaven and on the earth, prepare the reward 1, 30, 60, 100 (times more), and save us from each calamity on the earth and each judgment in the Heaven. For all of us, children of this sanctuary, sons of the Baptism. Forever and ever. Amen and amen. So be it.
desccontent.details: The incipit is not quite clear; the text seems to have been corrupted.

additional.cont: Fols. 35ra, l.13 - rb, l. 12: Additional personal names and invocation following the explicit.
additional.add: Fol. 35ra, l.13: ወለደቂቁ፡ ለኃብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ መዝገበ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወ[n.l.]። ዓመተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ጽጌ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኀን፡ ጸዋሬ፡ መስቀል፡ ማርቆስ፡ [fol. 35rb]ለመዝገበ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዓመተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወለተ፡ ጊዮርጊስ። ወኢታጽርዑ፡ አንብቦታ፡ አንትሙ፡ ካሕናት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ከመ፡ ትርከቡ፡ ዓስበ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ አሜን።
additional.tran: Fol. 35ra, l.13: And for the children of Ḫabtä Śǝllase, Wälättä Śǝllase  Mäzgäbä Śǝllase and ... ˤAmätä  Śǝllase, Ṣǝge Haymanot, Täwäldä Mädḫan, Ṣäware Mäsqäl, Marqos; for Mäzgäbä Śǝllase, his wife ˤAmätä Mikaʾel, Wälättä Dawit Ṣadǝqan, Wälättä Giyorgis. And you, priests and deacons, don't be lazy at reading it so that you might find a reward in the Kingdom of Heaven. Amen.
